title: U.S. Justice Department teams up with states on probe of Big Tech firms
text: The U.S. Justice Department is working with a group of more than a dozen state attorneys general as it moves forward with a broad investigation into major technology companies, the department's antitrust chief, Makan Delrahim, said on Tuesday.

title: Who's tracking you? Facebook users to get more control over data
text: Facebook Inc  said on Tuesday it was tweaking its policies to allow users to see and control the data that the social network gathers from their browsing habits on other websites and apps.

title: Better Buy:  MercadoLibre vs.  Facebook
text: Lots of potential for both, but a big difference in valuation.

title: Facebook's Libra faces EU antitrust probe: Bloomberg
text: Facebook Inc's  proposed digital currency Libra faces anti-trust probe by European Union regulators, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday, citing a document seen by the organization.

title: Here's how antitrust regulation may impact Big Tech
text: CNBC's "Power Lunch" team discusses the future of regulation that could impact the biggest technology companies with Mike Issac of The New York Times and Sara Fischer of Axios.

title: U.S. conservatives say Facebook needs 'significant work' to address concerns: former senator
text: A review by a former Republican U.S. senator concludes that political conservatives believe Facebook Inc needs to do "significant work" to satisfy their concerns that the social media website is biased, describing policies and examples that they found problematic without laying out evidence of systemic partisanship.

title: Gun sellers find loopholes on Facebook to sell guns
text: Yahoo Finance's Rick Newman and Adam Shapiro along with Direxion Managing Director Dave Mazza discuss how some gun sellers are able to sell guns by listing gun cases at a higher price.

title: Independent report on Facebook bias catalogues mild complaints from conservatives
text: An independent investigator has issued a preliminary report on its work determining the existence and/or extent of bias against conservatives on Facebook. It's refreshingly light reading — the complaints are less "Facebook is a den of liberals" and more "we need more transparency on ad policies.

title: 'A couple of dozen' states are eyeing Big Tech probes: DOJ official
text: “I think it’s probably safe to say more than a dozen. A couple of dozen state attorneys general have expressed an interest in the subject matter,” Delrahim says.

title: States attorney generals moving ahead with probe in Facebook, Google, Amazon and Apple
text: Yahoo Finance's Dan Howley breaks down why state attorney generals are reportedly launching an investigation into Big Tech.

title: Facebook is giving users a way to wipe their web history
text: The move comes as Facebook continues to grapple with its privacy practices and lawmakers' scrutiny over how it uses personal data to display ads. But it will probably won't have much effect on Facebook's business.

title: NRA posts old Facebook ads with ex-spokeswoman Dana Loesch amid threat of background check law
text: The National Rifle Association is turning to old stock footage of Dana Loesch, their former spokeswoman, to rally supporters in the wake of the recent mass shootings and possibly send a message to President Donald Trump.

title: Facebook 'suppresses' conservative views, says report
text: Facebook has "significant work" to do to address concerns from conservatives who believe the company is biased against them, according to a report.

title: Facebook users to see, control personal data taken from other websites
text: Facebook Inc  said on Tuesday it is tweaking its policies to allow users to see and control the data that other websites and apps share with the social network in aid of better targeting advertising.

title: Facebook political bias review tries to understand why conservatives don't trust it
text: The social network had a former Republican senator take the lead to determine if it has an anti-conservative bias.

title: Facebook launches 'clear history' tool – but it won't delete anything
text: Feature ‘disconnects’ data from a user’s account and shows extent of tracking apparatus

title: Facebook’s New Tool Lets You See Which Apps and Websites Tracked You
text: The tool is a response to criticism that Facebook has faced over how it safeguards its users’ privacy.

title: Facebook unveils new tools to control how websites share your data for ad-targeting
text: Last year, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced that the company would be creating a “Clear History” feature that deletes the data that third-party websites and apps share with Facebook. Today, the company is actually launching feature in select geographies.

title: Former GOP senator: Facebook has 'significant work' to address conservatives concerns
text: A year-long review by a former Republican U.S. senator says Facebook Inc  has "significant work to be done to satisfy" concerns from conservatives that believe the social media website to be biased against conservatives.

title: Facebook is hiring journalists to curate its news tab
text: The company confirmed it's hiring a team of veteran journalists to help curate news stories in its soon-to-launch news tab.

title: Facebook: Strong Metrics And Financials Make This A Buy Under $200
text: Facebook's balance sheet is as good as gold with zero long-term debt as its total assets and stockholder equity continue to increase.

title: China fights back after Twitter, Facebook suspend state-backed accounts
text: China said on Tuesday it had a right to put out its own views after Twitter and Facebook said they had dismantled a state-backed social media campaign originating in mainland China that sought to undermine protests in Hong Kong. Twitter said on Monday it suspended 936 accounts and the operations appeared to be a coordinated.

title: Facebook to let users stop app and website tracking
text: Facebook has launched a tool that lets users stop apps and businesses sharing their data to the social network in the latest move to improve its privacy.

title: RBC Has 4 Sizzling Internet Stocks to Own for the Rest of 2019 and Beyond
text: While the volatility in the market has sent some investors to the sidelines, the reason for the nervousness is global growth and the fears that it could slow major economies around the world into recession.

title: Amazon, Facebook and Google testify on French digital tax
text: CNBC's Elizabeth Schulze discusses France's tax on digital companies and a potential U.S. retaliation.

title: In New Facebook Effort, Humans Will Help Curate Your News Stories
text: A news section inside Facebook’s mobile app will be run by journalists and not just algorithms, the company said.

title: Exclusive: WhatsApp in talks to launch mobile payments in Indonesia - sources
text: Facebook Inc's  messaging service WhatsApp is in talks with multiple Indonesian digital payment firms to offer their mobile transaction services, in a bid to tap the nation's fast growing e-commerce sector, people familiar with the matter said.
